name: Passage
headline: Clear goods through customs, with AI
description:
Passage is a co-pilot for the customs brokering space. 

Today, companies employ entire teams of customs brokers and entry writers who spend hours keying in data and corresponding with clients. 

With our co-pilot, we plan to streamline this tedious data entry work, and email correspondence, making compliance teams significantly more efficient
tags: industry:generative-ai; industry:b2b; industry:logistics; industry:transportation; industry:ai; location:san-francisco-bay-area

founders.name: Terrell Marshall, Founder
founders.description:
Terrell Marshall is the co-founder and CEO of Passage.

Before Passage, Terrell worked on AI products with over 1 billion users at Google, like Google Photos, Google Payments, and Hotels Search, and as a software engineer at Workday. Before that, Terrell studied computer science where he met his co-founder Aditya Nadkarni and created a patent for an AI Physical Therapy Platform

founders.name: Aditya Nadkarni, Founder
founders.description: Aditya Nadkarni is the co-founder and CTO of Passage. Together with his co-founder, Terrell Marshall, they make customs and logistics workflows more efficient and better through the application of new technologies. Aditya spearheads the development of their platform, drawing from his experience at Flexport's AI and document processing team, and Artera, a start-up streamlining doctor-patient communication.

generated_description:
**Passage: Your AI-Powered Customs Co-Pilot** 

Founded in 2024 and hailing from San Francisco, Passage is on a mission to revolutionize the customs brokering industry through AI. Picture this: companies currently rely on whole teams of customs brokers diligently entering data and managing client communications, wasting precious time in the process. That’s where Passage steps in.

At its core, Passage acts as a co-pilot in the customs brokering space. By leveraging artificial intelligence, it aims to streamline labor-intensive tasks such as data entry and email correspondence, enhancing the efficiency of compliance teams. The goal is clear: make navigating customs a smoother, more automated experience.

Currently part of Y Combinator Batch S24, Passage has a small but dynamic team of two and is backed by David Lieb, its Group Partner. This startup is tagged with key industries like generative AI, B2B logistics, and transportation—signaling its adaptability and relevance in today’s fast-paced market.

For those interested in seeing how AI can transform customs processes, Passage invites you to book a demo on their website: [trypassage.com](https://www.trypassage.com/).

In a world of logistical challenges, Passage isn’t just another startup; it’s a forward-thinking solution that recognizes the pain points of the customs process and tackles them head-on. If you can streamline something as complex as customs with AI, you can make a significant impact. And that’s exactly what Passage is all about.
